channel.title: How do you make your chord progressions?
channel.description: Hey- just wondering what everyone’s thought process is when coming up with a chord progression. Personally I use a combination of theory and my ear to pick out nice chords. I’m lucky to have a pretty solid theory base, which means I can be creative whilst still making something cohesive. I’ve also got a couple of cliche progressions I love to pull out. Do you guys: -use ear -theory -past experience -imitate other songs chord progressions (totally legit btw- I do it too)

item.title: How do you make your chord progressions?
item.dc:creator: Db909
item.description:
I was thinking about why the soft notes are the way they are, and then I realized that they allow you to basically throw a whole bunch of notes down, building thick harmonies, and then easily sculpt away at them without deleting notes, and then it becomes pretty clear which notes you can/should delete

Read full topic
item.source: How do you make your chord progressions?

item.title: How do you make your chord progressions?
item.dc:creator: anon41616463
item.description:
It’s a common misconception only certain people can acquire perfect/absolute pitch. Technically everyone is born with the ability to develop perfect pitch. It is most easily acquired as an infant, as it is a critical period of auditory development and learning.
For adults, it’s near to impossible to develop absolute pitch, although some have pseudo-absolute pitch (yes, there’s actually different types of perfect pitch) in which is basically years of memorizing a note (e.g. C), and using relative pitch w/ intervals to base off the note. Although recently, there has been a performance enhancing drug affecting the ability of developing perfect pitch (Valporate).
I have absolute pitch myself, I didn’t realize I had it until like age 6, when my violin teacher told me I could identify any note on the piano. I used to think everyone had it when I was younger… lol

Here are a couple of links to check out if you want:

yadda.icm.edu.pl

httpaa_czasopisma_pan_plimagesdataaawydaniano2201105absolutepitchanditsfrequencyrange.pdf

1188.11 KB


Awesci - Science Everyday – 7 Jan 14

Valporate – Performance Enhancing Drug for Perfect Pitch

By Anupum Pant Today we find out if it would be a good idea to impress your friends during the next gathering by hacking your brain with pills to learn a rare ability fairly quickly. But first, pay…

Read full topic
item.source: How do you make your chord progressions?

item.title: How do you make your chord progressions?
item.dc:creator: Db909
item.description:
From the bottom up. I don’t really do block chords anymore so I just put some stuff down and start stacking rhythms, etc.

item.title: How do you make your chord progressions?
item.dc:creator: anon73773654
item.description:
Like I said above, I usually try out new things and just listen to them and decide if it’s good or bad. If it’s good, awesome. If it isn’t, I try again.

I’m one of those people who often get chord/melody ideas at random times. Fun fact: the chord progression for my latest track, Ocean, was originally thought of and written on a post-it when I was supposed to be reading in class…

Read full topic
